glsa.title: Adobe Flash Player: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: Multiple input validation errors have been identified that allow arbitrary code execution on a user's system via the handling of malicious Flash files.

background.p: The Adobe Flash Player is a renderer for Flash files - commonly used to provide interactive websites, digital experiences and mobile content.

description.p: The Adobe Flash Player contains multiple unspecified vulnerabilities.

impact.p: An attacker could entice a user to view a malicious Flash file and execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the player.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Adobe Flash Player users should upgrade to the latest version:
